key_facts: Cranswick proposed a large poultry and pig megafarm in Norfolk.
The facility would house 870,000 chickens and 14,000 pigs.
The farm would produce over 1 million tonnes of CO2 over 20 years.
Local councillors unanimously rejected the proposal.
The rejection was due to environmental and climate concerns.
Environmental groups opposed the proposed farm.
Local communities objected to the proposed farm.
The Labour MP for South West Norfolk opposed the project.
Concerns included air pollution and water usage.
The site is near protected environmental areas.
Planning officers found the proposal lacked environmental data.
Planning officers said approving the plan would be unlawful.
Cranswick claimed the farm would improve food security.
Cranswick said the farm would reduce the need for imports.
Cranswick said most meat would serve British markets.
The project was halted over ecological and climate impacts.
